title: My maths teacher is absolutely horrible and I'm not learning anything in class. What should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: You don’t always need a good teacher to learn. While your math teacher is not teaching and wasting your time, spend some time over looking at the example math questions on your math textbook. You can also learn a lot by going over the steps on the sample problems. If you don’t understand a subject, you can always find help online. Khan Academy is a very good resource that has tutorial videos and practice problems as well.

Get over it, and learn. It may be them, it may be you, but the chemistry is not conducive to learning. Find other ways of learning - co-learn with a fellow-student, engage with Khan academy, organise a tutor.But, be sure you know what the precise contents and requirements of this course is. The last event you want is a failure because you have missed vital information, or not submitted adequate assignments and projects.
